lines.name: MATT
lines.text: First and foremost, returning for tonight, our fantastic sponsor for campaign two thus far: our friends at D&D Beyond. Sam?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, D&D Beyond, a consistent and amazing sponsor of our show, wants to let you guys know that Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes is out! Get yours right now on the D&D Beyond website. To celebrate, I called my old friend, Rhody Slater.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You know, I just felt like at this point in my career I'd be doing serious shit like Ibsen or O'Neill, but I'm doing this shitty Keanu Reeves voice and writing crappy sitcom catchphrases. No offense, Ashley. This stuff is going to live on the internet forever! My kids are going to watch this and be like like, "Wow, your dad was a loser," you know?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, that's what we think all the time.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh sorry, I'm getting a phone call. This is embarrassing. Hello? Yeah, uh-uh. Really? Yes! I accept! Okay! Thank you. That was my agent. Guys, I booked a two-spot local radio campaign for Lord of the Wings, that new wing place in Chatsworth! Two radio spots! I'm a real actor again! I'm back! All right! Where was I? (As surfer) So wax down that twin fin and pull a thruster on an epic left because D&D Beyond is righteous! Banzai! (as Sam) What a crazy turn of events.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'm so happy. I'm so proud of you. You did it, Sam.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Congrats man, congrats buddy. Hashtag booked it!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wow, that was so authentic to the actor experience.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And really believable.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's just average.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's a regional spot!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I might get some residuals.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: On a side note, Matt, you look so quietly pained to hear Mordenkainen bathed in whatever that was.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I wasn't pained, I was more contemplating the fact that those two facets have never combined until this point probably. (surfer voice) Probably haven't heard anyone talk about Otiluke's Resilient Sphere. (normal voice) I like the prospect of a super Big Sur surf tour of D&D wizard names.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Lord of the Wings, I would go there. Just as a side note. Morden-cayenne wings! Let's do it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Road trip.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Would you like your pasta with Saruman the White sauce?" Thank you, Sam, and thank you, D&D Beyond, for being our amazing sponsor. And congratulations on your booking. First up, Vox Machina: Origins the hardcover collection, the actual physical tome of our first six-run comic series will be on sale next week on May 31st!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So shiny and beautiful! Oh my gosh, Laura wants to hold it.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I love it!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Get your fingerprints off it!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I just want to look at it, but you said I had to show it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It smells good, too. It smells like new comic.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Because it is a new comic!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Exactly!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's got some crazy back matter, too.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It does. Let me see real fast.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's so pretty!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's got some fun stuff and it's got some extra specials in the back.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait, we can show it? Are we going to show it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'm going to flip it real fast. We've got a map of Stilben. Ooh! It's gone now. We've got character traits and actions. We've got magical items! We've got sketches and various art pieces that show the process of development. There you go. It's got a whole bunch of cool extras in the back. Anyway, that's available next week, May 31st. For all info of the sale of the comic, check out critrole.com. We have it all up there as of right now. Awesome!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Critrole!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Foster hosts a little chat about whatever happens about tonight's episode, for next week.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That was the saddest woo-hoo.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That was-- yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did you just steal the comic book?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Huh?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Where did it go?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh, what? What?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Roll a stealth check.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: This is the way I'm shaped, what's wrong? This is my shape.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The Cube 2.0!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: This is my body, leave me alone.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh man, that Ashley, she's so... boxy.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Boxy! (hums the intro to "Foxy Lady")

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There you go. We have the Critical Role Live dice set in the store, as well as the Vox Machina d20 set is back in stock for a limited time.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is it still there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's on the list here.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sweet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Managing to keep out of the rain, you slept beneath your cart and awaited the next morning. As we come back in, you all have had your long rest, so if you haven't marked that in your character sheet, please do so.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And we leveled up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, level six!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, that didn't happen. As you come to, the cold morning greets you, the low mist and fog seem to still clutch the outer edges of the forest trees beyond your peripheral. You can just see the dark shapes of the trunks against the obscured gray. The mist and dew that is gathered on the grass and bits of vegetation near the base of the floor where you've slept has turned to frost with the cold night. Most of you managed to complete your rest uncomfortably, but awake to chattering teeth and the shaking of your body. Except for Jester.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (crunching)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The morning is yours. What do you wish to do?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What? You never fucking get cold or nothing?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't think so, no.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's get up and moving.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, please. Anybody got whiskey or something? Nott! You got any booze?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Of course I do.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Would you mind if I swig?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure, here's my flask.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Thanks. It's always full.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is it always full or it is always almost empty?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But I'm sure there's some sort experiment we could do to-- It's all right, you can have as much as you want. It's endless.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You don't have to buy alcohol at all anymore?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No. I mean, I rarely did anyway. I stole it, but now I don't have to do that either!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's wonderful!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah. I think it's about two-thirds full most of the time.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: May I try it?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's really good, it spreads through your chest like a fire.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How do you decide which alcohol is in it?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I decided the first time and that's what it is, always.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What if you get sick of it? You can't empty it out.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Why would I get sick of it? It's wonderful.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What if you want to try a different thing like--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Snozzberry.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Does it only fill up with one kind of alcohol?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, it replenishes with my favorite kind of whiskey.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Which is?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The kind that gets you good and drunk.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh good. I didn't know if it had a name.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I tried the other kind before, and really, it's not much.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: The kind that doesn't get you drunk is not very good.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Good and drunk.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Can you get it empty or close to empty if you try?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I could try.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I am not suggesting you try.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I think it's a good experiment.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I think so, too.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I do, too.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They already started it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe we shouldn't do that right before we go to the swamp where we're going to fight people.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's just see what happens! I'll drink a bunch.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You are very drunk.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Did it get lower?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I grab and shake it, with my thumb over the spigot.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's still filled with liquid. I mean, you drank a lot, and it still feels like half-full.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Should you puke it up?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (slurred) I don't want to waste it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You can't really waste it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, it's bottomless.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You've already used it at this point, really.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (slurred) I guess I could. Should I throw up now?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe you should try.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: In the name of science.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Stick something down my throat.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nott, just put your finger down your throat.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I find a stick. Open up!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (yelling and gagging) Did it work?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Eventually, yes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't want to hurt your throat, you know.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Face pointing up, though, so it projectile Bouncing Betty vomits everywhere?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: In a very Ren and Stimpy fashion, Jester begins jamming this stick into Nott's gullet, before the brackish brown whiskey comes back up in a mild spray against the nearby, now damp, dirt and grass.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is it steaming in the early morning cold?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It would be.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But do you feel better though?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, not really.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Probably not, how is your esophagus after that?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: A little sticky.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: A little salsa?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: A little burny?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How many fingers am I holding up?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I think four?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How many members of The Mighty Nein are there?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Nine.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: She's okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But two are always gone.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's true.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I feel like when I see someone else throw up I feel almost like I do (retching). No?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's a violent reaction.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Jester, help her out there, she's in need.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you want me to stick something down your throat?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Uh-oh. It's still happening.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is it just seeing someone throw up or is it also hearing the sound that makes it worse? If I just went (retching) does that--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, I think it's the sound, too.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Looking at our map, how much longer do I think we have to go to get to our destination?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you move quickly, you can probably get there right around sunset.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is this quickly like "not paying close attention" quickly?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's "not carefully and quietly" quickly.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I think we're good for that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, we're fine.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We're not concerned at all about that-- what do you call it when you get ambushed?

lines.name: MARISHA, LIAM, TALIESIN
lines.text: Ambush.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Last night.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You're our strategy guy, right?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's early in the morning, I'm not awake yet.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We beat them, though.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We've been traveling for years, we've been ambushed dozens of times.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm just checking. Didn't know if anybody was alarmed.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is it normally ogres that ambush you?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, that was new and exciting.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Especially if we're staying on the main path, you know, we'll see anything that pops up.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fair enough.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We want to rush? You want to rush? Let's take it slow and we're going to get to the swamp just as the sun is going down if we rush, and that is full of nasty things, I'm sure.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's actually a very good point.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: If we go slower--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We get there in the day.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Carefully then?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't mind camping out.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: One more time?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: One more time.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You all are an enjoyable lot, it will be fun.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That was very believable, Caleb.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think he was being genuine.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That was very impressive. Thank you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I feel like that was the most emotion--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think I've ever seen.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is Caleb blushing at all?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: A little. His ears are getting a little pink.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Maybe a little.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does anybody else want to drive the cart today, or do you want me to keep driving it?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll drive if you want to switch out later on.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right. I got it. Nott, I assume you want to be in back.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Molly up front keeping the horses on task, you guys pick up the pace and get back out of the forest main cluster and onto the Bromkiln Byway heading north-northeast once more.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Carefully.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Are you moving at the slowest pace?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Not the slowest pace.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Medium. A five.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: A normal pace.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (singing) I drive the cart at a medium pace.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Not willy-nilly, not galloping pace.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Pressing forward, what two are maintaining a watch as you progress?

lines.name: LAURA, LIAM
lines.text: I want to watch.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: One of you is aiding the other. Who is helming the roll?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I want to stand on the cart and stand up for the ride and look around.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's like Muad'Dib riding the sandworm, standing up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'll put my hands on Molly's horns and--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm into this.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'll take the back. Caleb, can I hold Frumpkin again?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Am I rolling twice?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Twice, yes.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I like him.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I also do have a large tapestry that's relatively clean if anyone's feeling cold.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's not good. Could we make that tapestry into coats?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Nine! Because it's appropriate.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: For the first half of the day, you continue along the path. It gets rough in places, and at one point one of the wheels slams into a rock. You have to double check and make sure it didn't take any damage. It seems to be okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We saw that.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I can drive.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: For the first half of the day, nothing catches your eye in particular. The mist has burned off at this point, and a bit of sunlight is breaking through the clouds. It seems the storm from the evening before has passed. You can see now over the mostly gray cloud cover, there are breaks in it, from this distance you can see these visible beams of sunlight slowly coasting across the grass fields as you see the heavy, high grass pushing and pulling with each burst of breeze that makes its way across the valley. It's very beautiful here in the center of the Empire. It's a very relaxing ride, though you know you're book-ending your travel with tension to stress, so you're taking this moment to appreciate what it is the Empire protects and what the people within are fighting for in the coming conflict. Second half if the day, same people on watch?

lines.name: MARISHA, ASHLEY
lines.text: I'll take a watch.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'll sit down, I've been standing for such a long time.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's true, give those ankles a rest. Who's helming the roll?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll helm.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're aiding Beau. Roll with advantage.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sorry, 17.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 17, all right. Continuing your pace, Beau as you're watching out, from a north-northwestern direction, you see a dark shape come over one of the hilltops, wide and encompassing.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Moving?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It seems to be. A number of miles out of the way, almost on the horizon, you can see this series of rolling hills in that direction that obscure what lies beyond that area. You watch as one of the hills goes dark on top, like the coloration gets covered in shade.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What does the weather look like? Are there clouds in the sky?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are clouds in the sky, especially at this time of year, it's generally pretty cloudy here in the Empire. You've seen breaks in the clouds as you've traveled for most of the day, it's been warmer than usual, so it's been a welcome change of pace from what you're used to, but this is not characteristic of cloud cover, as most everything here has some level of shade.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Still rolling grasslands, or are there trees off to the side?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What you slept in the night before has probably been the largest cluster you've seen in your travel today so far. This catches you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It looks like the landscape is going dark? Not something moved in front of it, or like something is moving?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct. Best you can tell at this distance.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Who's got good eyes and knows about clouds and shit?

lines.name: NOTT
lines.text: Caleb knows about clouds.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I've spent a long time on the road, too.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Does that look natural to you?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You both look out there and as you travel for the next ten minutes or so, you can see faint glimmers in that moving shadow as a bit of sunlight travels over it. It's at that moment you realize what this is. It's a legion. What was a dark shadow appears to be hundreds and hundreds of soldiers, an army regiment that is shifting from the northwestern side of the Empire to cross over the byway, heading east. As you continue your pace forward, you get to a point where you may intersect with their path if you continue, or you can slow down or speed up. It's your choice.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There are a lot of soldiers ahead, and I don't think we should have anything to do with them.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Plus if we wait, it'll take a really long time for them to cross the road.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's a very good point.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: If we move, though, we have to move fast, and maybe a little bit carefully.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Let's go! Go!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You come up over one of the hills and then down another embankment. As you curve around the side, there's a part where the grass has overgrown a large majority of the road here, but you coast through the center.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We should stand up and ride it like a surfboard!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's not do that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Like Teen Wolf?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a general animal handling check if you don't mind, Molly.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Seven?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's terrible.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you hit that portion of the road, you're having a hard time steering the horses, you're not entirely familiar enough to pull on the rein of multiple at a single time to get the shift and movement. They begin to careen a little bit off of the path, almost trying to hide into the grass embankment which slows your movement down ever so slightly, before (impact) one of the wheels suddenly (impact and scraping). It is now digging into the ground.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I can desperately try and right the stuff, I suppose.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did it break the wheel?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The cart is now sitting at a backward angle and it's slowing down.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We could climb to the other side of the cart and try to balance it so the wheel comes up.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to pull hard on the reins, see if I can get it out of the--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And continue, or stop?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, are we "stop" stopped?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's grinding to a halt.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay, I'm stopping the whole thing really quickly.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm going to hop off the horse and go look.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I go ahead a little bit and see if I find any hidden paths that might cut through this field, off the main road? Scout ahead a little bit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, make an investigation check. You go and check. It looks like some sort of heavy rock that was hidden and obscured in the grass, just off the road, had slammed into both wheels on the left side. The front one had bent, the wood splintered inward and the metallic rim on the inside had bent inward. The other one had completely been pushed inward and knocked at the angle, it's pretty wrecked.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no, is it fixable?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Do any of you guys have tools to fix a wagon?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Would we know?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What toolkits would you have at your disposal?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Your background would tell you, if you chose a background, what bag of shit you have.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Your background may have abilities that could help you in this scenario as well.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Vehicles in water.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Things that are helpful: carpenter's tools, possibly. That's kind of rough.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I have ball bearings.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I have an axe.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm pretty sure I saw carpenter's tools and I was like, who needs that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Anybody?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I've got a hammer, I've got some rope. I don't know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I have rope. I have lots of rope.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I think we're going to need to double up on these horses, you guys. Or at least unhitch them from the wagon.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, and get all of our stuff off of the cart. But I have our giant lead safe in here.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh yeah.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: How heavy is it?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's pretty heavy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys are having this conversation, the regiment is coming up over a nearer hill and it's about half a mile off from you now. As it's marching, you can hear the distant rustling of hundreds and hundreds of footfalls making their way through the field.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: In our direction?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It looks like they're going to be probably passing in front of you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Should we hide?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I rolled a 15.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You rolled a 15? There is no natural paths here, it's an open field. There are areas where the grass isn't quite as dense, and there are some spots where some of the dirt isn't as receptive to grass. You find patches of dry ground, but there are no paths that you notice leading out of this space, unfortunately.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You don't know any Mending magic, do you?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (gasps) I have Mending! I have a Mending cantrip.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do. What's the space on Mending?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You're welcome. I'm sitting here thinking, if only we had a Mending cantrip of some kind.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I have that!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I have, for two minutes, been thinking: If only I had the Mending spell.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You guys, I can mend things. Thanks for reminding me on that, Molly.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I just had to say it out loud.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can you try it on the wheel?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (pigeon coo)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, I can try it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's just do it! Let's see what happens.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you focus on the front wheel, the one that had just dented inward and the wood splintered a bit, that was barely keeping it up, the wheel rights itself. The metal bends back into place, the wood splinters kick right in, the spokes are as if they were untouched.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Guys, I'm amazing!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, you are!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That would have been way more amazing if I'd remembered that I could do this. Let me try it on this other wheel, though.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait, we have two broken wheels?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, one was partially damaged, the other one was pretty wrecked. The other wheel, unfortunately, has taken a fair amount of damage from the impact, and the lower half of it has broken inward, it's splintered out and it's bent its way off of the axle. Unfortunately, it's a bit too big for the Mending cantrip to fix.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Can I try to punch it into place?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's pretty wrecked. You do have three wheels, which means you could try it.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: One of us could be a wheel?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yasha curls up around the axle.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How far away is the army?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You probably have about ten minutes before they cross over the byway.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, I'm going to come over and be like: I think we should hide and wait until these guys pass with this being the situation.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How tall is the grass around here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Beauregard, Caleb, Molly and Jester, you guys notice, breaking away from the regiment above, you see a cluster of horses heading in your direction. You are out in the open.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are we going to get questioned?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We could pull the cart off the road if Yasha picks it up and runs along with it.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I could try. We could also kill those people and take their horses.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, I think the army would see it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll use Disguise Self and I'll turn myself into a crownsguard.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Nott, you should hide.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We should look like we're people that are peasants or something.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I agree, what's our story?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Right? To retrieve stuff for the crown? For Zadash?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No. We needed help because our family is in the swamp.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: We could say we were helping out-- what was her name?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We're just traveling hired hands. We are going to go to the swamp and look for yard work.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You should move the safe.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: In the swamp?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I push the safe off the cart.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, Yasha and Jester should take the safe.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (horse galloping)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are there any woods or anywhere to hide?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's high grass. The grass off the road where you guys are standing right now is, for you, almost shoulder-high.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to go in the grass.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Stealth check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm just going to sit on the wagon looking bored.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I just bought it. It's in the bag.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: 22. Am I still drunk? Do I need to--?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, you've been traveling for half a day since you left, so you've pretty much sobered up.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Maybe they can help us fix our wheel.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's my thought.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The good stuff's in my bag. Don't worry.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Five horses have now galloped up and slow to a trot as they come up alongside, loosely circling the side of your cart, in the direction of where the legion is. They approach; they are all dressed in Righteous Brand full armor, helmets on, blades or bows slung across the shoulders. One of them approaches, "Hail!"

lines.name: LAURA, TALIESIN, ASHLEY
lines.text: Hail.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Good day.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Apologies. We're going to be crossing the road here shortly. We may require your patience "and shifting--"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We have a broken wheel, anyway. We're not moving at a particular speed at the moment.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Could you help us?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Of course. Just of curiosity, where are you headed?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We are headed to this swamp place.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We are headed north.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Labenda.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The Labenda Swamp.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Labenda? I wouldn't wish it upon my worst foe. Well, good luck. I am Captain Maximilian from "Druvenlode."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Captain?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What does he look like?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Through the helmet, you see a well-trimmed bit of chin facial hair, short, comes from under the lip. No mustache, but you can't see if it continues to the rest of his face.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Where's he from again?

lines.name: SAM, MATT
lines.text: Druvenlode.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Druvenlode.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Load or loat?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Druvenlode.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Max Load, got it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Goddamn it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Where are you all headed?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'm going to do a little hashmark every time.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Just carve it on the back of your DM's screen like a prisoner.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At the end of the campaign, you look at my side of the Wyrmwood table and it's all these horrible marks carved into the wood.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Like Zsasz from the Batman comics?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Captain, where are you headed en masse like this today?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, it seems that the forces of the Empire are heading east to keep the rest of you "safe. Let me see what we can do."

lines.name: TALIESIN, LAURA
lines.text: Thank you so much.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He turns the horse around and begins to head on back, three follow him while two stay in the area. Not close to you, but holding down the fort, keeping an eye on the road and look behind.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do either of them have saddlebags?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They both do.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can I do a little Mage Hand-y? A little fishing in the one that's closest to me?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You very well may. Make a sleight of hand check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do any of us see this?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This can't possibly end poorly.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: None of you see this, especially not him or his horse.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You included the horse.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Horses notice things.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fuck you, horse.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The saddlebag flips open gingerly, then reaches in and a small pouch, relatively heavy, slips out and makes its way over to you and into your grasp.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I hold on to it. Can I peek inside?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do. It is filled with dry oats and corn.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's a good one.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Bunch of little things. Can we ask you-- are you familiar with the Labenda Swamp?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The captain has ridden off, so one of the two other people that are there-- you now look within the armor. One is male and one is female, and the female soldier turns to you. She has a tense stare and a broad-shouldered look as she turns in your direction. "I've never been, but I "hear it's pretty shitty."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Seems the same as what he just said, we're not quite sure what to expect. Any tales or stories you can share?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "From what I've heard, at the very least, it's not very comfortable, but people seem to "like it and live there still. It's one of the older provinces in the empire, that I know. Not "for me."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Would you rather be headed there or where you're heading?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That's not really a question, unfortunately. In times of war, we go where we're "needed. We're needed to the east so that you don't have to go and wade into the battlefield "yourselves."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How long have you been a soldier?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "This will be my eighth circle."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Have you seen the frontline before?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I've not, I'm both terrified and eager. You know, you daydream of glory and then, who knows "once you get there. But I get the sense that you've seen your fair share of battle in your day, "right?" Looks right towards Yasha, this hulking woman with a giant two-handed greatsword on her back.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (high-pitched pigeon voice) Stop smiling! Anything else but that!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They carry large packs on their side, and you can hear the jangling of metal implements inside. One of them has pieces of wood, some strips. They get off the horse, and at this the captain goes, "Right, "there's the cart. Do your business. We're going to do our best to help you get back to the road, friends."

lines.name: MARISHA, TRAVIS
lines.text: Thanks, captain.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thank you so much for your help.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Of course." The two gentlemen go over and start giving each other commands. "Lift up "there." One of them pulls it up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you need any help?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "By all means, if you have the-- right, then." Jester's now holding the whole cart up by herself. They get down, pull the wheel off and begin to bend it back into place. One of them goes through a small pack of various pieces of wood, some that appear to have been soaked and are somewhat pliable. Ends up replacing the broken wood, nailing it in place. Just to be safe, they take some rope and tie it over the wheel very taut to try and hold the bent wood. "This should get you at "least to town. I can't guarantee it will last you for a long journey, but I recommend a replacement "once you get there."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thank you so much.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Of course. Come on." They get back on their horses and they ride back. At this point, the regiment has now crossed over the road, and you can now see hundreds of soldiers going across the Byway. The captain gives a nod, puts his helmet back on. "Well, I wish you all luck. Stay safe and "I hope that if luck is kind to us, we'll cross paths again."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Stay safe as well. Thank you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Stay safe.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Bye.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Everybody be safe.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They turn around and they make their way back up to the rest of the army. About 25 minutes or so it takes for the group of soldiers to finally cross over the path.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Actually it was faster than I expected.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, it wasn't a huge army, per se. Not as big as the one you saw leaving Zadash. In total, it might have been, maybe, 1000 soldiers.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The Kiss army, basically.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Now that the way is opened, your cart seems to have been temporarily repaired. You make your way your way back onto the road and continue your heading north.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Could I try Mending again and see if what they did made it to where I can fix it now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure, I'll say for the purposes of this, make a wisdom check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, no I'm wise.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's the most insane roll I've ever seen.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There you go. Because you were so close, you were able to see all of the points in which they attempted to repair the wheel and now that they've closed the gap on what is currently cracked and on the verge of collapsing if this fix wasn't centered around it, you manage to concentrate and with that each one of the--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Traveler be with us.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You watch as the wood refixes itself and becomes a solid wheel.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ta-da.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's very handy, Jester.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Very cool.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Good trick.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's fitting that the Traveler helps fix a wheel.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Amazing.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Right?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's very poetic.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I like it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You see that, Caleb, that's almost as powerful as the shit that you do.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's not get crazy, what he can do is incredible. Have you seen him in action?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Have you seen my lollipop?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: She did just lift up the carriage.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh yes, she's super strong, yeah. Just her magic, there's no--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Don't make me Inflict Wounds on you, Nott.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There's nothing that's being said here that can't be said at full momentum.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh no, are going to ring a bell in my head?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With that, the cart lurches forward. You all have to catch up real fast to scamper back onto the cart as Molly has picked it up again. You get yourself back on the road and heading northward.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Keeping watch, for the rest of the way, eventually the sun comes close to setting and you haven't quite gotten within visual range of the swamp. You're coming to a relatively hilly portion of the terrain and ahead most of the valley tends to cruise upward where the hills are now cresting and obscuring the horizon. But the sun is setting, so you may be looking somewhere to camp, unless you want to push through the night.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I think we should camp, because then we will hit this swamp at a more advantageous moment.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Let's see if we can find a rise on one of these hills to camp on the top.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hey Fjord, have you had any more weird dreams?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, very peaceful, actually.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are your dreams affected by the weather? Like if it's cold, do you throw up ice shards instead of salt water or something?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Because that can be cool.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, I could see how that would appear that way.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And kind of painful, probably.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: More that. It hasn't happened that frequently.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, but not yet. If it does, I'll let you know.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How frequent is it?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's only happened a couple of times, honestly.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: A couple of times you have spit out seawater?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, yeah, just the once, actually.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We don't know if it's seawater, though, right? It could be like saline.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Saline solution?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do you wear contacts?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Hey, you're not supposed to drink that stuff. It's for rinsing.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't abide by the rules. I walk my own path. Like a twister, I was born to walk alone.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Maybe that's your problem this whole time.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fuck the rules. Give me saline or give me death.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Smash cut to Fjord's grave.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, shit.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We gave him saline.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This week's episode brought to you by Bausch & Lomb.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you continue up towards this particular hillcrest, there is a small patch of high bushes in an older campsite. There is a clearing of the grass, where it's mostly rock and dirt with some bits of dried brush. There's a rock formation, with a bit of charcoal and blackened ground where a fireplace had previously been set.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This will do just perfectly. Let's do this.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Let's set it up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys bring the cart off to the side, set up your evening arrangement, light a small fire there in that same rock circle. Who's taking first watch?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Silver thread around the fire.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll take first.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll join.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: One of you make the watch roll with advantage, as the other is giving aid.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Natural 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (rumbling) And another.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: One-one thousand, two-one thousand, three-one thousand. Is it getting closer?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You listen for a while and it is getting closer.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are we exposed? Like, out?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys are out in the open, yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We're at the top of a rise, so we can see really well.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're going to get rained on.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can we all huddle under the--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're not awake.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I mean, (snoring)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't mind rain.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do we have anything-- We don't have actual tents, do we? We don't have proper tents?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not unless any of you have it within your pack, but otherwise all you have is your cart.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This is why we should have taken that circus tent, man.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I have an idea, let's carve the bellies out of the horses, and we climb inside.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So that we don't get wet?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Full tauntaun style.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are there any caves nearby? I mean, we're kind of by a thing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's hilly terrain and the topography shifts a bit, but right now all you see is darkness beyond your immediate darkvision peripheral.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We're going to get wet.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How many of us can fit under that cart, I wonder.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Even then, the ground's going to get--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Disgusting.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Soaking.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The occasional flash of light you see in the distance begins to frame an ominous shape far to the north: the beginnings of a mountain range that you have been able to see previously or hadn't paid attention with the darkening sky.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did you guys wake us up because of the storm, I'm assuming?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I think the storm's going to wake you up soon enough.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And it does. Those who are taking the first part of your evening's rest come to as the storm begins to come over. The weather gets colder, you feel the rain imminent within the next hour.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I was curious of that too.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What is he looking for?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The map.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, it's right there.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (singing) Get out the map!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How close are we to the Xhorhasian border?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're pretty far away.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We're going here.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: These are not explosions, orange or red?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, these were lightning bolts in the distance in the storm.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh there's Druvenlode! There's Max Load.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Silberquel Ridge, perhaps? Hupperdook is beyond that mountain range.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does that mean that guy was named after a whole city?! Does that means he owns a city?

lines.name: MATT, TRAVIS, LIAM
lines.text: He was from Druvenlode.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, I thought that was his last name.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: His name was Captain Maximilian.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I mean, if he was taking the Leonardo da Vinci approach then it could be accurate. Max of Lode!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Hmm. I think we just need to hunker down.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'll take the next watch because I don't mind the rain.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The rain begins to kick in your vicinity.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'll take next watch, too.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The fire begins to go out.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm getting underneath the cart.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Me too!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm going to get on the cart and try and put my cloak over me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, the cloak you have is treated with simple wax to try and resist most water. You'll probably be a bit soggy in the morning, but it's doable.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm staying up. I like the rain.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I look at Molly underneath me on the cart and I fart a little bit. Just a little.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm down here, too! (farting noise)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Not a little one. Don't gamble on those.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Alcohol and beef jerky, man.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: At least I'll definitely notice the smell like fucking roses.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sorry.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The first watch goes beyond the rain without incident. Who is taking the second watch?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It is a big group of us, yeah? Is there enough people left over to do the last watch?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'll take last.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, there's only been the first watch.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Which was Molly and I, next one is Caleb and Jester.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, I didn't hear that part. So Caleb and Jester, who's keeping up? Who's the point man on that watch?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, your eyesight is better than mine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make your check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Just regular plain old check?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this point it's midnight, so it's pitch black.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's not bad. 19.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You keep watch throughout the area, now without the warm glow of the fire to give you a good visual perspective. All you can go by are the distant flashes and sometimes close flashes of lightning. (thunder) A loud one hits, probably striking a tree no more than two or three miles from where you are. All of you get jostled awake for a moment before getting yourself back to sleep.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Big one, did you see that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If I could have everybody leave the table except for Yasha, please.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What?!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The storm!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Shit! Storm!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh shit! (yelling)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All it says is, "You walk the right path. Be "strong. Don't forget who you were, and decide who you will become." The vision fades back into darkness. (thunder) Another blast of thunder and this time you wake up suddenly. The rain is still pouring outside. You're amongst the grass. Can we get everybody else back in, please?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay, okay, okay. Holy moly.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You wake up. You're shivering a bit from the cold and the night air. The ground has dampened, even beneath the cart. You were sleeping beneath the cart, right?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Near it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Did she go back to New York?!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm here!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay, good.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That would be fucked up, if you used that as your exit. Wait, where-- what do you mean Ashley left?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You forgot to say goodbye. She's just gone.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (singing) Never say goodbye!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So was she a Xhorhasian spy and are we all dead in our sleep?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll a perception check-- no.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is it water or blood that we're covered in?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you come to consciousness through this evening's rest for your final watch, as you gather after that sleep is probably not going to find its way to you again for the rest of the evening. Who is taking the final watch with you?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh man, Jester and I talked about everything. Like, everything. About childhood, favorite kind of ice cream. We know everything about each other now.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Pistachio or Rocky Road?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm going to mull it over in my sleep, good night.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Third watch is going to be either Yasha and Nott, or Yasha and Beau.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll take it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: One of you two make the watch perception roll.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You can do it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Just make a single roll.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay, eight?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you all rest for the final length of the evening, Yasha and Nott, you stay up chatting as much as you like or staying quiet as much as you like. The rain still pouring through in sheets heavily.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How you holding up? Can I go under you? Can you be like a shelter for me? Like a lean-to?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Sure, if you want to get under my hood here?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wing?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Well, it doesn't come out all the time.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't know how it works.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It's just if I get really mad.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But your arm is probably big enough to shield me from the rain. Thank you.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Are you dry?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Thank you, yes. I don't like to get wet.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I feel like I don't know if I want to keep doing this.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's okay.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay. Could you give me a moment?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Give you a moment?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm going to go to the tree over there.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do you have to take a piss?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, I won't look.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I look.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I go where near the tree was struck close to us.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's about a quarter-mile walk from where you are, but you can head there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's not that long of a walk, quarter mile.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you approach, you can see near the top it's been carved right down the center and part of it has splintered and exploded. There are chunks of wood around the vicinity and you can see even amongst the rain, on the interior of the exposed trunk there are still faintly orange glowing embers from where the bolt had struck through the night.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (whispered) And a baseball bat.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (whispered) Lemonade.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I heard you, and I wanted to thank you for saving me, and I promise you I will be the best servant you ever had. Thank you. I'm going to take a piece of the bark and I'd like to carve the symbol into the tree, the Stormlord symbol. Not very good, but just to have it there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The bark is a harder utensil to utilize to carve into bark.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Sorry, I take a piece of the bark to have and I use my sword.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can take it and carve in the edge there using the tip. It takes you a few minutes to do so, but you manage to complete the shell of the symbol's outline and then make your trek back to join up with Nott.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I got a piece of this bark from that powerful lightning that struck it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You got bark from a lightning-struck tree?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, I wanted to put it in my things. I like to have things from nature.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do you collect things? I collect things.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, I do!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What kind of collections do you have?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I pull out my book. I mostly put flowers and things in here because I'm collecting them for someone and I want to keep them all in here from my travels.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, it's beautiful! Is it a special someone?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Someone back home? That's so nice.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah. But what are the things you collect?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I collect all sorts of things. I have a button collection. I used to collect stamps, I used to collect different kinds of vials of different sorts of fluids and things like that. I collect soles of shoes. Not shoes, just the soles.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh, just the bottom bits.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, they come in many different shapes and sizes. The cobblers throw them away when they're bad. You can fish them out of the trash and you can have a whole bunch of them.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: What do you use them for?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Nothing. I mean, you can play a little drum thing with them.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: And should you need to resole your shoes--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure, if you string them together, they make a Roman gladiator belt sort of a thing.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Have you ever put them one on top of the other and make a platform shoe?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ooh, I could be a little bit taller! I think if you put two on top of each other and push them in, it looks like lips are talking!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Cool! Well.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I feel like we've gotten to know each other so well!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Very much so. Do you want to get back under here?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, under your gigantic arm, thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As Nott cuddles up alongside Yasha's comparably hulking form to keep out of the water, you finish your final watch as you both watch the sun begin to rise over the horizon-- or at least, you can't see the sun, but you can see the day grows lighter as it makes its way over the cloud cover. The rain is not quite as strong, and the lightning seems to have subsided, but it is still a light drizzle when it comes to the proper morning. As the rest of you come to consciousness, completing your long rest, the day is yours, damp as it may be. The low fog and mist still encompasses most of the valley around you, and it's a beautiful sight as you glance around first thing in the morning. You can see only the tops of the hills slowly breaking through the layer of cold mist that hits the lower valleys between that shifting topography. As you look off, you can now have a much better view of the Silberquel Ridge above this large mountain range that marks the geological center of the empire. As you glance down, you can barely make out what might be the swamp.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What's the temperature like right now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's pretty cold. I'd say it's probably in the high 40s.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We have to be miserable right now because we are soaking wet and it is cold.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is not my first time.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ah, it's like a day at the beach!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's not freezing point yet, but it's definitely cold and wet.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, I miss having a proper tent, and the wagons were nice. I miss that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We should get some waxed canvas or something.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Something at least.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How'd the rest of the night go? Any lightning strikes or anything crazy?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: There was a big one close by.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: There was?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It happened right before I went to sleep.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Did you see it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Where Molly pointed over there, you see what was once a tree is destroyed and splintered.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's so rare!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It tipped it right over.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's ama-- I mean, right? Lightning strike?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Don't know.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Happens every time it rains.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm going to run over and look at the tree.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's impressive.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. Can I take some little twigs and pieces of wood and put it in my little component pouch?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: They're good luck.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's what I've heard.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, tree struck by lightning, very good luck.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Really?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I've only seen it hitting the water and it's just (explosion).

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I heard it was bad luck. That's what I was told.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's bad luck for normal people.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Fuck.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So what kind of people--?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Everybody else!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So I should go?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Absolutely!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to go get some of it too!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's take the whole fucking tree!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Dig it up! (laughter)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Attach it to the back of the horse. Go!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Destroy the cart?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fuck.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I go over to take a look at it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I am working on a thing. I have not got it figured out yet, but I think that I could make some sort of shelter for us so that this doesn't have to happen again. I haven't worked out all the-- what?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: A magical shelter?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Or just out of waxed cloth?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, how do you mean?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, magic, of course. But I don't have the-- I've been working on it, but I haven't struck to the--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You need more paper?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You need more incense?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, I always need those things, but I need more time and more research.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, if you come up with an ingredients list, we'll be happy to drum stuff up.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Thank you, Mollymauk.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Talking about making shelter, that sounds great.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What kind of a shelter?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This sucks.

lines.name: TRAVIS, TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, it does.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Like a dome, like a bubble dome? How do you mean?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I have higher hopes of-- I mean this is a long ways off, but I would love a large home or a mansion of some kind that you can (snaps) on a whim. Doesn't that sound amazing?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's impossible. You can't make something like that!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Caleb can do it if he sets his mind to it!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Like some sort of phantom manor is what you're speaking of. It would appear--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That sounds like that wouldn't be something that's real.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, I've never heard of anything like that.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Me neither.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Doesn't have to be real to be interesting.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We have all of us seen magic in our lives.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I like this plan. I'm into it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Nothing is impossible.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: But I see from her, you know? She fixed a wheel.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I fixed a wheel.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That is correct.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Naturally, she could make a house next.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I could do it because I can make a giant lollipop.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You have faith, so you should have faith.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I have lots of faith.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: If you can, Caleb, that would be quite remarkable.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is it considered faith if you just really like somebody?

lines.name: TRAVIS, TALIESIN
lines.text: No.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well listen, nothing gets the blood warmed like movement, so perhaps we should pick up and get going.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to, before we take off, take a look at that tree that got hit. I want to examine how it was struck by lightning.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an investigation check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Beau does pushups while waiting for Molly.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Actually, this would be more of a nature check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right, nature. Three.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's struck by lightning, man. Pretty impressive.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is this practically like a little bowl now, or did it split?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It split, and a lot of the tree is still standing, but it's broken open from the center, and one half of it's broken away and shot off into multiple pieces.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to drop a piece of silver in the center so the next person who comes around and examines this thing finds a piece of silver.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, cool.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Also, Caleb has watched Beauregard go to town on 100 pushups or something, and I go maybe 40 feet away and I try as well. I do one pushup, and then I go study Siff Duthar's spell tome some more instead of going to two.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Fair enough.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are we waiting here for a while?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, you guys are moving on.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, we're on a moving cart?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You are now.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I want to ride on a horse today!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys begin to pick up speed and head down, you're now at the very top of this major series of hill clusters and making your way down towards the base of the Silberquel Ridge.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Probably not a great idea, but I'm going to--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Do you have alchemy supplies on you?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, I bought a kit. I've been trying to do it for a while, but we've never stopped.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. I would like you to make-- hold on, it's roll plus proficiency because you're proficient in alchemy, plus, this will have to be dexterity at disadvantage because you're in the back of a moving cart.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Wooden wheel cart.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: 16 plus proficiency is 19.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But now I roll at disadvantage.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Roll a 20.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Nine. That's a 12.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You manage to succeed in spite of the-- at one point, it gets a little dodgy and you almost drop it and catch it before it begins to spill the nearly completed acidic formula all over the center of the wooden cart, eating through it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You're making cocktails?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You manage to complete one vial of acid, so you can mark that down.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: One vial of acid, great.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys approach the mountain range, you can see the clouds now that have pressed down obscure the peaks of the top of the range. You can see the darkened mountainous form vanishing up into the top, gray, whereas in the distance, sheets of rain that are still coming down much heavier to the north obscure your ability to see further beyond the northward valley to either side of the range. You also see the southern base of the mountains, which is the direction you're heading. You get the sense that the watershed-- that most of the mountain range seems to almost lean to a southward direction, so the watershed of all the rain pours and slides down the mountain to this one central southern area, and there you see the darkened, tangled, thick swamp of Labenda, your destination.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ugh, it's going to suck even more because of this storm.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sitting deep green and distant, tangled and sprawling before you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How far up is it about?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: From where you are now, I'd say it's eight or so miles.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hey, at least it's cold so there won't be a lot of bugs around. Normally, bugs are terrible in swamps, I hear.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'd rather be cold than have bugs.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Right?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah. It's a very fair point.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Continuing your path on for a little bit of the morning, eventually you begin to watch as the grasses begin to give way to more... moistened-- that's a fun word to use, moistened-- terrain. The normal dry-- even after a rain, the damp ground is now becoming sludgy, and the path itself, the road, seems to have been well-built and set for this type of travel. But even then, it's starting to gather on the wheels a bit as you ride through, and you can see bits of it are clustering up and leaving this groove in the ground behind you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Who's on a horse? Am I on the cart, or am I on a horse?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm on a horse.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll be in the cart then.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll be in the cart.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Cart.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to take one of the swords and start using the flat of the blade to scrape the wheel and give it an edge to start removing the mud off of it and hop between wheels.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, and you move around each one. It doesn't get too bad, thankfully, because it's still pretty slick. When it clumps on, it generally slides off. It's not immediately damp from the first time for most of the vicinity here.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no, and if you start to lose hope, your horse sinks into the mud and it's gone forever.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That fucking movie traumatized me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: However, the edge of the swamp begins to breach the path that you're heading. You begin to see the swamp grasses take over from the hillside. You begin to see the heavy puddles of swamp bog water beginning to appear to the right and left. The trees you're used to seeing here in the middle of the field are giving way to banyan trees and other thicker-trunked, gnarled bases, heavy, thick vine-covered canopies. The insects begin to fill the air with a weird buzzing.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, I thought there wouldn't be insects because it's cold!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: In addition to the insects, do we start to become aware of wildlife around? Birds and beasts?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do we know anything about where we're going?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We're going to see a safe house that the lights have been out at.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're trying to find Febron Keyes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, but it's a big swamp. Are any of us good at like wood stuff? Is this me? Am I the girl?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm good at nature. I've lived in the woods for a long time.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm okay at surviving.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: About half an hour or so of travel along the road into the center of Labenda Swamp, the humid air prevents the mounting sweat on your body from evaporating, causing your sweat to pool in your armor in uncomfortable ways. Your breathing is somewhat shallow as you adapt to the moisture in the air around you. The ever-present hum of the buzzing insects begins to permeate the atmosphere around you, while the musky stench of decaying plants and stagnant water grow stronger the further in you pass. A very low fog, since it's still relatively early in the day, sits across the surface of the water that's exposed in patches between where the thick roots and soft rotting vegetation seems to be sitting, like a spongy ground.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm going to take my staff and poke it in the marshy bits.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you push down, it sinks a few inches. As you pull back, the portion that you had pressed in remains, but the water begins to fill up the space where your staff had pushed in.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: On the plus side, I think sitting in the cart, that Caleb is probably the cleanest he has been in two years because it's been raining non stop.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You get about another half hour or so on the path before Beauregard, Caleb, Molly and Jester, all at once, you hear this strange trilled cry of some kind. It's like, (cawing).

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I cast Mage Armor on myself.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Mage Armor.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That sounds like it was talking, or did that sound like a bird?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think that sounded like a bird talking.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It sounded like an alert to me.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I don't think I heard anything.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should we call back?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What should we call back?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (cawing)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay, that's what we decided to do?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's not a good idea.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nope.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Maybe it's a mating call.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe it's just a bird.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't see how that's any better.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You hear it again, only this time it sounds intense, or frantic. The strange (bird croaking).

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Does it sound like multiple, or from the same source?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It sounds singular, so far.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Where's it coming from? What area?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's coming to the right, off the road, like deep into the swamp.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's over there.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are we going to stop? We're moving?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys are still moving forward on the path.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can we look, can we see? Can we see into the swamp?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Natural one!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you're glancing out there, a piece of stray vegetation, falling from one of the nearby trees, flitters into your eye.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ow! I got a leaf-- No, I think it's a leaf.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Use Mending.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I use Mending on my eye.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No effect.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Now that we've continued on, how do the wagon wheels look on the road as we're moving? Are they leaving tracks that's filling in with water behind us at this point?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Faintly.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Not like the staff push, though.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, she was pushing off the path. This road is designed to not sink heavy with the rest of the swamp material. A lot of travel happens in and out on this main path on the byway. As long as you're on the path, for the most part, you should be fine.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is this considered the Berleben path?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is the path to Berleben. The Bromkiln Byway is the road you're taking.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The Bromkiln. So this is not--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're in the swamp.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The road goes through the swamp.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, and Berleben is further in the swamp.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I would say that Caleb has spent a lot of time over the last several years in woods. Can I check to see if I have ever heard that cry before?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a nature check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That is an 18.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right before its bones were crushed and it went lifeless, it's a very similar sound.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's specific.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No movement that we can see, just the sound?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, just the sound. It's loud enough where it's not that far off the road, but it's not in sight right now. There's too many tree trunks obscuring your vision.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Branch canopies over us at this point?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's still light coming through, and as you travel, there are bits and pieces that overhang the road, but you still have open sky ahead of you. You don't think it's going to continue the further into the swamp you go.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Fjord, will you look at my eye? I think there's something still in here.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, here, look up. Yeah, you got like a tree booger in it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Fjord, get it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, god, this is the worst part. Can I try and get the boog out of her eye?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll a dexterity check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Please be a one. Please be a one. Please be a one.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Natural 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With a deft flick of his finger, he manages to pluck the piece of vegetation from your eye.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wow! My hero.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I got it, Jester.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thank you Oskar-- I mean Fjord!
